page.title: 05Freeman's Woodyard
page.content: Freeman's is a big timber merchant and builder just behind the school.Before it became a business it was a farm and one of the old barns is still standing.The offices are in the old farm cottages.The firm is 110 years old and is the main employer in the area.Mr. Stenning showed us around,he has worked there for forty years.He showed us the wood they import from Russia,Finland and Sweden.Swedish wood is marked with a crown and Russian with a star.He said the best wood comes from Russia because it is colder there and the wood grows slowly giving better quality timber.The Russian wood comes from Archangel by boat to Shoreham,then on by lorry. Freemans stock all the different shaped pieces of wood you need to build a house.
